title: For Makeup that Performs, Look to Drag Queens
summary: The art of drag has undeniably influenced how ordinary people shop for and apply their cosmetics. More recently, a new guard of queens is hoping to cash in on the transaction.

title: Retail Emerges as Most Distressed Sector in Europe, Report Says
summary: Retail is suffering from weak discretionary spending, margin compression and tightening credit conditions, pushing distress in the sector to the highest level since the global financial crisis in 2009.

title: Ulta Beauty Chief Financial Officer to Depart, Interim Leader Appointed
summary: The American cosmetics retailer said on Wednesday that longtime financial executive Chris Lialios will serve as interim chief financial officer until it finds a suitable replacement for outgoing CFO Paula Oyibo.

title: Fantastic Man Magazine Launches in China
summary: Former Yves Saint Laurent creative director Stefano Pilati will join Fantastic Man China as editor at large.

title: New Balance Bets Its Basketball Future on Cooper Flagg
summary: The brand known for its running shoes is making its mark in the basketball business after signing 18-year-old NBA Draft top pick Cooper Flagg.

title: Can Korean Fashion Be as Big as K-Beauty, or K-Pop?
summary: K-fashion made significant inroads in becoming a part of a global fashion conversation in 2025, with brands like Post Archive Faction and Gentle Monster grabbing attention. But scaling the category to become as big as other cultural exports remains challenging.

title: The End of the Founder-Led Era
summary: Over the last decade, an avalanche of brands with public-facing founders emerged. While a prominent founder can propel growth, customers use other factors to assess whether a brand is suited to their needs, according The State of Fashion: Beauty Volume 2.

title: AI Shopping Platform Daydream Launches in the US
summary: The site, co-founded by Julie Bornstein, aims to reimagine online shopping with the capabilities of the large language models underlying AI tools such as ChatGPT.

title: The Tenth Edition of BoF VOICES Is Coming: First Speakers Announced
summary: Prada Group CEO Andrea Guerra, model Jean Campbell and MSCHF founder Gabriel Whaley are among the global experts who will share their insights at BoF’s annual gathering for big thinkers, now in its tenth year.

title: Swiss Antitrust Authorities Open Investigation Into Nivea Pricing
summary: The group known as COMCO said on Tuesday it will investigate the mass skincare brand’s parent company, Beiersdorf, over a pricing dispute with a local retailer.

title: The Indie Beauty Brands Transforming Africa’s Hair Care Market
summary: A crop of upstart brands are betting on Africa for their next global expansion, ready to benefit from the continent’s growing middle class. To kick-start Africa’s premium hair care market, they’ll need to carefully consider marketing and retailer strategy, as well create a new value proposition.

title: The Founders Pushing African Fragrance Into the Mainstream
summary: Across the continent, a handful of nascent brands are attempting to kickstart the continent’s own niche perfume moment. Success will take mastery of retail, e-commerce and branding across borders.

title: Selfridges Wins Approval for Private Members’ Club
summary: The Westminster City Council approved an application to convert space in the department store’s flagship London outlet into a membership venue with a terrace and private dining room.

title: Forever 21’s US Operator Wins Court Approval to Liquidate
summary: The embattled fast-fashion company's repayment plan includes a settlement with lenders and former Forever 21 parent Sparc Group that’s designed to boost recoveries for unsecured creditors that stood to get pennies on the dollar.

title: Glossier CEO Kyle Leahy to Exit
summary: After three years as chief executive, Leahy will step down from her role by year-end, and will retain her board seat while assisting the company in finding a successor.

title: Swedish Textile Recycler Syre to Partner With Gap, Target as Demand for Sustainable Clothing Grows
summary: The H&M-backed textile recycling firm will supply the US retailers with recycled polyester.

title: Inside Gap’s Last-Ditch, Tariff-Addled Turnaround Push
summary: The iconic ’90s retailer was on the precipice of death for years. Richard Dickson finally had momentum for a comeback — then came Trump.

title: Target Explores Factory-Direct Shipping Model Used by Temu
summary: The retailer is in early stages to broaden its range of low-cost offerings, which would primarily include apparel, household goods and other non-food items.

title: The ‘Silicon Valleys’ of Beauty Brace for Tariffs
summary: From Seoul to Melbourne, new cities are emerging as frontrunners in the beauty start-up space. The independent brands created in these hubs are fast becoming hot acquisition targets, but understanding the limits of their global appeal is key.

title: The Return of Old-School Celebrity Campaigns
summary: Brands are reverting to retro celebrity testimonials to drive awareness and renewed interest among ad-weary consumers.

title: Ready for Relaunch? Jonathan Anderson’s Dior Challenge
summary: The stakes are high for the designer’s debut at the French megabrand as owner LVMH faces mounting pressure to resolve problem areas in its portfolio.

title: How Haus Labs Mastered the Art of the Comeback
summary: The Lady Gaga-fronted line went through a renaissance, changing its product offering, distribution and overall look and feel to better connect with customers. CEO Ben Jones tells The State of Fashion: Beauty Volume 2 how the brand pulled it off.

title: How Turkish Brands Conquered the ‘Rest of the World’
summary: Turkish fast-fashion giants LC Waikiki, Koton and DeFacto have rolled out hundreds of stores in high-growth, high-risk frontier markets like Albania, Uganda and Mongolia where rivals H&M and Zara have little or no presence.

title: The Debrief | The Jewellery Boom, Explained
summary: Even as luxury fashion brands face declining demand, jewellery sales are booming. The Debrief explores how smaller designers and novel pieces are capturing consumer interest and finding new paths to growth.

title: Worldview | Iran-Israel War Disrupts Local Businesses, Poses Global Risks
summary: This week’s round-up of global markets fashion business news also features JD.com’s turnaround plan, pan-African e-commerce giant Jumia and Ecuador’s crackdown on Chinese e-tailers.

title: Amorepacific’s Road to Success
summary: The K-beauty corporation behind brands like Laneige, Aestura and Sulwhasoo sees global expansion and ongoing innovation as keys to growth, chief executive Sean Kim explains in The State of Fashion: Beauty Volume 2.

title: Telfar’s 20th Anniversary Show: A Celebration With a Message
summary: On Saturday, the brand, best known for its cult favourite ‘Bushwick Birkin’ totes, held its first runway presentation in three years in an alleyway behind its flagship store, where family and community came first.

title: Unilever to Acquire Men’s Personal Care Brand Dr. Squatch
summary: The consumer goods giant announced on Monday that it had signed a definitive agreement to acquire the American men’s brand, known for its soaps and grooming products.

title: Elliott-Backed Claire’s Eyes Sale as Tariffs Hit Budget Jeweller
summary: Claire’s needs to address a nearly $500 million loan due in December 2026 and recently chose to defer interest payments on its debt to conserve cash.

title: Chinese Makeup Brands Are Winning Over Global Consumers
summary: As the popularity of alternative social media platforms like RedNote grows outside of China, domestic beauty brands like Florasis and Judydoll are reaping the benefits.

title: Hilton to Enter Cruise Business with Waldorf Astoria Nile Ship
summary: The hotel group’s Waldorf Astoria Nile River Experience, set to launch in late 2026, follows similar moves by Ritz-Carlton, Four Seasons, Orient Express and Aman.

title: Why Jewellery Feels Like a Better Deal Than a Handbag
summary: Jewellery brands have raised prices less than fashion labels, and now benefit from a stronger sense of lasting value.

title: Can TikTok’s ‘Shirtless Race’ Become More than a Trend?
summary: Hyrox, a grueling strength-and-endurance race that pops up in major cities, is far more than a workout to its legions of fans. Now it's betting on becoming the next spectator sport.

title: How Kiko Milano Built Pricing Power
summary: The Italian cosmetics giant has deftly engineered a premiumisation strategy, and has elevated its distribution, product selection and points of differentiation, heavily reducing discounts and promotions in the process. Chief executive Simone Dominici explained how it deployed its strategy in The State of Fashion: Beauty Volume 2.

title: Customers Want Beauty Brands to Prove Their Worth
summary: As beauty customers grow more selective and cost-conscious, brands must demonstrate a clear and ownable value proposition, regardless of price, according to the BoF-McKinsey State of Fashion: Beauty report Volume 2.

title: The Fashion and Beauty Opportunity on Snapchat in the Gulf
summary: BoF sits down with Snap Inc.’s vice president and general manager of the Middle East, Hussein Freijeh, to learn more about the changing social media landscape in the Gulf, its impact on consumer behaviour, and the new opportunities it presents for fashion and beauty brands to reach audiences in the region.

title: Exclusive: The Whitaker Group Expands With New Women-Centric Retailer Jaide
summary: It will be the US group’s first foray into women’s retail as it looks to expand its popular streetwear retail empire.

title: At Milan Fashion Week, Highs and Lows
summary: Milan’s menswear showcase felt particularly frail this season, though there were a few standouts, reports Angelo Flaccavento.

title: Exclusive: Skims’ Plan for Global Domination
summary: Kim Kardashian’s shapewear brand is preparing to enter many new markets in the US and, increasingly, globally. CEO Jens Grede spoke with The Business of Fashion about his vision to create ‘the Apple store of apparel.’

title: Calvin Klein Bets on Body Sprays to Be Gen-Z’s Obsession
summary: As the fight for teen relevancy and wallet share intensifies, the Coty-produced fragrance line will launch an all-new collection of affordable body mists.

title: Amazon’s Premium Beauty Push May Be a Buffer Against Trump’s Tariffs
summary: The Seattle-based e-commerce company is betting that sales growth in its beauty category, which includes Estée Lauder’s Clinique, Olaplex and L’Oréal’s Urban Decay, will offset the impact of tariffs on its upcoming Prime Day event.

title: US Strikes on Iran Come at Fragile Moment for the Global Economy
summary: The outlook now hinges on how forcefully the Islamic Republic retaliates, with any trade disruptions caused by a further escalation of the conflict acting as yet another brake on the world economy.

title: Prada CEO Gianfranco D’Attis to Exit the Brand
summary: Prada Group’s chief executive Andrea Guerra will take on the role of the brand’s CEO on an interim basis.

title: River Island Plans to Close 33 Stores, Putting Hundreds of Jobs at Risk
summary: CEO Ben Lewis said the British fashion company would try to 'keep [job losses] to a minimum.’

title: Giorgio Armani to Miss Runway Shows As He’s ‘Recovering’ at Home
summary: The Italian fashion designer will follow the shows remotely while menswear head Leo Dell’Orco will greet guests on Saturday and Monday in his stead.

title: This Week: Nike’s Earnings and Jonathan Anderson’s Dior Debut
summary: In their own ways, both companies will provide major updates on how they plan to win back customers.

title: UTA Names Darnell Strom to Lead London Office
summary: Strom will step into a newly created UK leadership role as the agency positions London as a hub for its expansion across Europe, the Middle East and Africa.

title: How to Make a Members Club Work in New York
summary: Private clubs like LA’s San Vicente and London’s The Twenty Two are flooding New York City. Can they make membership a ‘must-have’ for a new generation of affluent New Yorkers?

summary: A new generation of private clubs has commodified elitism, argues Allison Schrager.

title: Exclusive: Bata Group Names Panos Mytaros as New CEO
summary: The former boss of Danish footwear brand Ecco will join Bata in September, taking over from Sandeep Kataria.

title: BoF Insights | The New Era of Fashion E-Commerce
summary: Based on a proprietary survey of fashion shoppers across the EU5 — those in the UK, Germany, France Italy and Spain — and BoF Insights intelligence, this new report, developed in collaboration with Amazon Fashion & Sports in Europe, reveals how fashion brands can meet rising customer expectations and nurture long-term loyalty in an increasingly competitive online retail landscape.

title: ‘Transform or Die’: Can a Turnaround Expert Turn Kering Around?
summary: Luca De Meo’s appointment as the French group’s chief executive is an admission of the seriousness of the crisis the company is facing, as well as a signal of its intent to do something about it, writes Imran Amed.

summary: The European Commission is abandoning regulation that would have required companies to back up green claims following pressure from conservative lawmakers.

summary: Tracee Ellis Ross shares her journey from Hollywood actress to entrepreneur with BoF founder and CEO Imran Amed, detailing the systemic changes she’s driving in the haircare industry.

summary: At Pitti Uomo, there was a sense of nostalgia that felt both backward looking and progressive, reports Angelo Flaccavento.

summary: The luxury goods maker is reeling from a sharp downturn in the €364 billion industry — and questions about succession are growing louder.

title: Lessons in Make-Or-Break Costuming From the Carolyn Bessette-Kennedy Backlash
summary: The online ire over the initial peeks at Ryan Murphy’s upcoming series about the tragic love story of John F. Kennedy Jr. and Carolyn Bessette-Kennedy is a case study on why it’s important to get costuming right on TV.

title: Umit Benan Is Back
summary: With a new Davide De Giglio-backed venture offering ‘bespoke prêt-à-porter,’ the master tailor is once again in the spotlight and will unveil a new collection and retail concept on Friday in Milan.

title: Meta Launches $399 Oakley AI Smart Glasses
summary: Meta introduces new Oakley smart glasses, expanding beyond Ray-Ban, targeting athletes and leveraging AI capabilities.

title: Pandora Is Hiring on BoF Careers
summary: Check out this week’s new partners and openings on BoF Careers, the global marketplace for fashion and beauty talent.

title: BoF Live | Rethinking Success Metrics for Brand Ambassadors
summary: Join us on Wednesday, July 2 at 16:00 BST / 11:00 EDT for our next #BoFLIVE.

summary: Carolyn Bessette Kennedy’s precise shade of blonde generated a lot of press this week, but online the late style icon’s hair drama is getting upstaged — by Jennifer Garner.

title: Mike Ashley’s Frasers Drops Out of Bid For Revolution Beauty
summary: The British fashion group has decided not to go ahead with an offer to buy the ailing cosmetics brand, the company said Thursday.

title: Luxury Counterfeiters Are Outsmarting the Industry
summary: Purveyors of secondhand luxury goods may be losing the fight against increasingly sophisticated counterfeiters. Do customers care?

title: Dealers at Art Basel Sidestep Politics, Reap Rewards
summary: The fair featured mostly safe, apolitical works, which appeared to play to the mood of buyers.

title: Opinion: Luxury Is More Resilient Than the Market Suggests
summary: The luxury industry is facing another lost year, according to Bain’s latest luxury update, but investors are being too gloomy on the sector’s long-term prospects, argues Andrea Felsted.

title: Why Kering Picked a Fashion Outsider to Be Its Next CEO
summary: The Gucci and Saint Laurent owner is splitting its chairman and CEO roles, bringing in Luca de Meo, a turnaround expert who has revived multiple automotive brands, to support the Pinault family.

title: Temu US Sales Plunge 25% Amid Tariff Barrage
summary: Temu’s US sales are declining due to significant cuts in advertising spending, a direct consequence of new tariffs, while Shein’s sales have begun to recover.

title: As Kering’s Fashion Cools, Pomellato Heats Up
summary: Even as demand for luxury goods stalls, Milanese jeweller Pomellato is gaining ground by appealing to self-purchasing women and expanding into high jewellery — a welcome win for Kering as it works to re-energise its portfolio.

summary: At The Business of Beauty Global Forum 2025, Unilever Prestige’s CEO, Mary Carmen Gasco-Buisson, shares how shifting consumer expectations around value are reshaping prestige beauty, in conversation with BoF’s chief business officer and head of beauty, Johanna Stout.

summary: Executive Members are invited to join senior correspondents Sarah Kent and Sheena Butler-Young, along with executive editor Brian Baskin for an informal breakfast discussing Selling to Consumers in Uncertain Times.

title: Luxury Sector Will Continue to Slip, Bain Forecasts
summary: The market is on pace to contract 2 percent to 5 percent in 2025 as consumption remains soft across key categories — particularly leather goods, makeup and watches — according to the latest forecast from Bain & Company.

title: China’s Extended 618 Shopping Festival Fails to Stir Excitement
summary: E-tailers JD.com and Tmall-owner Alibaba have not disclosed the event’s overall sales figures for years, but analysts warn that a recent pause in some government subsidy programmes could weigh on consumption this month.

title: Swiss Watch Exports Slump in May as US Tariffs Shake Market
summary: Exports to the US, the sector’s single-biggest market, were down just over 25 percent, underscoring the impact of President Donald Trump’s trade policies.

title: LA’s Protests Have Ended But Fashion Can’t Shake Off Its Fear
summary: Following the ICE raids and a week of protests, the city’s fashion employers continue to fret about what’s to come as the White House continues its deportation campaign.

title: Nike Delays Launch for New Brand With Kim Kardashian’s Skims
summary: Despite the delays, Nike still expects to release NikeSkims products sometime this year, Bloomberg reported.

title: Lululemon Is Cutting 150 Corporate Employees After Review
summary: The impacted roles are at the retailer’s store support centres, according to a statement from the company.

title: Fashion Castoffs Dumped in Protected Wetlands in Ghana
summary: Shipments of unwanted old clothes from UK and European brands have turned a conservation site into a dumping ground, according to a new investigation.

summary: The funding round marks the first time the Los Angeles-based womenswear brand raised outside capital after its initial $1 million seed round. The new capital will go towards its retail expansion.

title: US Retail Sales Post Biggest Drop in Four Months
summary: US retail sales declined more than anticipated last month, though clothing sales rose by 0.1 percent between April and May.

title: New York’s Fashion Workers Act Set to Go into Effect June 19
summary: The Model Alliance, New York State Department of Labor and fashion industry stakeholders gathered Tuesday to celebrate the new law, which establishes regulations for fair treatment of models — including, preventing management agencies from charging unfair fees and giving models control over their likenesses created with AI.

title: Francesco Risso Exits Marni
summary: The Italian designer crafted a colourful, DIY-inflected universe during 10 years at the OTB-owned brand.

title: Ben Gorham to Exit Byredo
summary: The founder of the Swedish fragrance label is stepping down as Puig completes its takeover.

title: Beautycounter Would Like To Reintroduce Itself
summary: Back under the ownership of founder Gregg Renfrew, the beauty label will relaunch on June 25 as Counter, keeping its clean formulations and giving up its MLM-style compensation model in favor of “community commerce.” Renfrew talks exclusively to The Business of Beauty about her vision for the new brand.

title: Strategic Reinvention: Growing a Beauty Brand with Staying Power
summary: At The Business of Beauty Global Forum, Front Row’s chief revenue officer Christopher Skinner and Tatcha’s chief marketing officer Nicole Frusci joined BoF’s Alice Gividen on stage to explore building a lasting beauty business in an ever-changing market.

title: How Dubai Is Defying the Luxury Downturn
summary: Last week, Zegna staged a runway show in Dubai the emirate, following in the footsteps of Roberto Cavalli, Armani and Chanel. The emirate remains the most established hub for luxury shopping in the Gulf region, which has bucked the industry’s downward trend.

title: How Homme Plissé Fits Into Issey Miyake’s New Menswear Strategy
summary: The Japanese brand’s fastest-growing line is ceding the Paris fashion week spotlight to IM Men and taking a ‘slow road’ with traveling events powered by a new ‘open studio’ strategy, starting with an Italy-inspired presentation at Pitti Uomo in Florence.

title: Shein Is Struggling to Clean Up Its Dirty Image
summary: The company’s latest sustainability report shows it’s still fashion’s most polluting player, with planet-warming emissions that far outstrip those of rivals and help make the brand a target for politicians and regulators.

title: Clothing Retailer Dynamite Raises Prices 9% Amid Trade Tensions
summary: The women’s fast-fashion retailer plans to raise prices at twice the rate of inflation in the future.

title: The Debrief | When Fashion Lost Its Voice
summary: As immigration raids in Los Angeles spur large-scale protests, the fashion industry has remained largely silent. The Debrief explores the reasons behind the muted response and the tangible actions brands can take to support vulnerable workers.

title: A Slap on the Wrist Won’t Solve Luxury’s Sweatshops Problem
summary: This week, Italy’s Competition Authority closed a probe into whether Dior misled consumers about working conditions at its suppliers without finding any wrongdoing. But a new case linking Valentino to poor labour practices suggests this is a problem that won’t go away easily.

summary: In a challenging market, a generation of brands that helped pioneer 'sustainable fashion' are shifting their sales pitch, letting design, not values, do the talking.

summary: Akt London, Yse Beauty and Ruka were the young brands that captured the Global Awards jury’s attention.

summary: The British retailer’s director of group finance, Aaron Izzard, will replace outgoing CFO Dave Murray.

summary: This week’s round-up of global markets fashion business news also features Cambodia’s apparel exports lift and China’s consumer boom.

summary: The American cosmetics giant's share price surged 13 percent following a report in Women's Wear Daily that the company is considering selling its luxury and consumer divisions as separate units.

summary: Max Schiller is relaunching the cult Swedish label after bringing on his brother, Acne Studios co-owner Mikael Schiller, as investor and chairman of the board.

summary: The artificial intelligence-powered styling platform raised a seed round with funding from investment firms including Arnault family-backed Aglaé Ventures.

summary: The shift comes after new Indian restrictions forced global brands to pause imports of footwear.

summary: From everyday sunscreens to tinted offerings to the best for dry skin, body and beyond.

summary: Hager's partnership with the resort and spa booking app will feature the first novel from her new book imprint, Thousand Voices.

summary: Zach Rieken has taken on the top spot at Odele.

summary: The beauty retailer reaffirms fiscal 2025 guidance as an external search for a permanent CFO begins.

title: EXCLUSIVE: Glossier CEO Kyle Leahy to Step Down at End of Year
summary: The beauty brand will begin a search for Leahy's successor.

title: All the Beauty Retail Expansions of 2025
summary: An ongoing list of retail forays by beauty and wellness brands in 2025.

summary: The Unilever-owned brand is launching a line of mood- and skin-enhancing body care products, including cleansers, scrubs and serums.

title: Fragrance Dupe Brand Dossier Is Opening Stores
summary: The viral, 2019-founded brand, best known for its "Impressions" line of designer- and niche-inspired perfumes, is betting on stand-alone retail.

title: The 10 Biggest Beauty Brands on Social Media in France — From L’Oréal Paris to Dessange
summary: Monthly data from Traackr shows who's winning on French consumers' social media feeds.

title: How Skinfix turned a reformulation flop into a rebranding and community-building opportunity
summary: When Skinfix’s exec team reformulated its hero Triple Lipid-Peptide Cream last year, it didn’t expect an outpouring of frustration from its most loyal shoppers. But instead of doubling down on the "new and improved formula," the brand used the misstep as an opportunity to connect with its community and bring back the original cream alongside a full rebrand. Glossy sat down with CEO Stuart Leitch to learn more.

title: Fashion Briefing: How brands from IWC to Pacsun are hitching a ride on Formula 1’s explosive growth
summary: It’s no coincidence that there are more fashion collaborations with Formula 1 than ever before. With products from licensed T-shirts selling for $35 all the way up to one-of-a-kind Formula 1-inspired watches selling for over $1 million, fashion brands have continued to latch onto the sport’s growing popularity.

title: Unilever’s new acquisition, Glossier’s CEO shakeup — plus, Arrae’s Siff Haider on forecasting wellness trends before they hit big
summary: In the big wide world of health and wellness, there is always a buzzword du jour. In the past couple months, you've likely heard buzz about gut health and GLP-1s, ingredients like creatine and colostrum, and, of course, protein. For many of these trends, Arrae, the supplement brand co-founded by Siffat "Siff" Haider and her husband, Nishant Samantray, has been right there, answering consumer demand with a product featuring that of-the-moment ingredient or speaking to a top-of-mind concern.

title: The fragrance brands dominating Instagram are not the same ones making bank on TikTok
summary: Luxury brands like Parfums de Marly and Kilian dominated Instagram for the month of May, according to a new report from Mintoiro. The more polished aesthetic dominant on Instagram does not always translate well to TikTok’s more DIY appeal, however.

title: Luxury Briefing: Can Jonathan Anderson turn Dior’s best-selling Book Tote into a fresh growth engine?
summary: In this week's luxury briefing, a look at the revival of Dior's book tote. Also, a new shopping app that claims to fuel brand loyalty, the latest executive moves from Miu Miu and YNAP, and news to know.

title: Beauty & Wellness Briefing: The beauty supplement market is expanding as beauty and wellness continue to merge
summary: This week, I checked in on the burgeoning beauty supplement category. Additionally, Unilever is set to acquire men's personal care leader Dr. Squatch, there's another exec shakeup at Violet Grey, and Beautycounter founder Gregg Renfrew is back with Counter.

title: All the ways conflict between the US and Iran could affect the fashion industry
summary: The main risk that market analysts are predicting is a global rise in energy costs due to the conflict obstructing important shipping lanes, which would disrupt a market where many consumers are already cutting back on discretionary spending.

title: From Guava to Sardine Girl Summer: Why beauty can’t stop serving up foodie trends
summary: Foodie microtrends like "Guava Girl Summer" have taken off as an appealing way to repackage standard beauty looks under a new name. But they also speak to consumers looking to participate in a lifestyle via their fashion and beauty choices.

title: Anthropologie’s ‘Tobie’ dress is the unexpected style of the summer
summary: On Thursday, Katie Sturino (803,000 Instagram followers) and Lindsay Silberman (214,000 Instagram followers) posted about the same dress. The dress, which is called the Tobie and made by a brand called Exquise, is sold exclusively at URBN-owned Anthropologie. It's available in multiple lengths and fabrics, and ranges in price from $178-$228. And, although it has been popular since its launch in February 2024, it may just be the dress of summer 2025.

title: Unpacked: The consumer brand guide to B2C CRMs
summary: This Unpacked guide, sponsored by Klaviyo, explores the ins and outs of B2C CRMs — how they offer something unique for B2C brands compared to legacy CRMs, the difficulties B2C companies face when retrofitting B2B CRMs and examples of brands that have achieved major success after switching. While the initial iterations of customer relationship management […]

title: Why authors are fashion’s next top models
summary: Ten years after literary icon Joan Didion appeared in a Phoebe Philo-era Céline campaign, writers like Zadie Smith and Ottessa Moshfegh are getting their due in fashion.

title: ‘Champion has to be back in pro sports’: How Authentic Brands Group is turning Champion around with sports league deals
summary: Champion's new owners have a central strategy to turn the brand around: realigning it with professional sports.

title: Beating price sensitivity without slashing margins
summary: Rose Murray, senior content editor, Scayle In light of the recent global tariff turmoil and the resulting economic uncertainty, customer loyalty is more fragile than ever. According to Scayle’s 2025 shopper survey, shoppers are gravitating towards a higher level of cost consciousness. As a result, 36% of U.S. consumers admit they would ditch their favorite brand […]

title: Inside Cowboy Colostrum’s summer of activations
summary: Cowboy Colostrum just launched a third flavor of its powder hero product, Strawberry, and to celebrate, it is embarking on a summer of related activations — all on the East Coast, with a specific focus on the Hamptons.

title: Glossy Podcast: Kering’s new CEO, FIFA’s luxury bid, France’s anti-fast-fashion bill — and a conversation with Warby Parker’s Kim Nemser
summary: Our editor-in-chief, Jill Manoff, sits down with Warby Parker’s chief product and supply chain officer, Kim Nemser. The conversation covers Warby Parker’s omnichannel strategies, with a particular focus on how it’s integrating AI into many of its back-end operations.

title: Fashion Briefing: How H&M is using real-time data to merchandise stores based on optimal sales
summary: In this week's fashion briefing, a deep dive into how H&M is putting data into the hands of store associates to convert customers. Also, what brands should look out for with Google's in-search checkout, plus future retail trends from The Future Laboratory and the latest earnings from Vince.

title: Goop plans for 20-30 new brick-and-mortar locations as it opens its 7th permanent store
summary: Goop’s in-house brands, Goop Beauty and G Label, will fill 80% of the new 647-square-foot Aspen storefront. It marks the company’s seventh permanent location, with 20-30 more to come over the next few years, Matthew Blythe, Goop’s vp of retail, told Glossy.

title: Luxury brands should rethink price hikes to win back disillusioned Gen-Z shoppers
summary: As luxury brands struggle with declining sales and bad PR around how their goods are made, they may need to rethink their pricing strategy to bring back lapsed luxury consumers and jaded Gen-Z shoppers.

title: Sahajan Skincare’s Lisa Mattam on clinical testing to validate old-world beauty ingredients, plus beauty news from L’Oréal, Coty and Byredo
summary: Blending the old and new, Lisa Mattam’s 10-year-old clean skin-care brand Sahajan uses cutting-edge clinical testing to validate ancient Ayurveda traditions and ingredients. “If I'm going to tell people that this old-world science can transform their skin, I have to prove it to them,” she told Glossy. Mattam breaks down the cost, timeline and unseen challenges of clinical testing in this week’s episode.

title: Luxury Briefing: How luxury brands are using Pitti Uomo to enter the European market
summary: Pitti Immagine Uomo, the menswear trade show held twice a year in Florence, kicked off this week. And this year is continuing a trend that began in 2024: Pitti is becoming more international every year.
